checkpoints.title: Select ALL functional groups present
checkpoints.hint: Levodopa is an amino acid with a catechol ring (two phenolic OH) and a carboxylic acid.

checkpoints.title: Choose the best pharmacophore description
checkpoints.hint: Levodopa is a dopamine precursor and uses amino acid transport into the CNS.

checkpoints.title: Pick the most accurate SAR / concept statement
choices: Catechol increases COMT metabolism (shorter half-life without inhibitors)
Adamantane makes it highly polar and non-CNS
correct: Catechol increases COMT metabolism (shorter half-life without inhibitors)
checkpoints.hint: Catechols are classic COMT substrates; COMT inhibitors prolong levodopa effect.

checkpoints.title: Carbidopa is best described as:
choices: peripheral AADC inhibitor (does not cross BBB well)
correct: peripheral AADC inhibitor (does not cross BBB well)
checkpoints.hint: Carbidopa inhibits peripheral dopa decarboxylase to increase levodopa reaching the brain.

checkpoints.title: Which property best explains its peripheral selectivity?
checkpoints.hint: Peripheral selectivity is taught as limited BBB penetration (more polar).

checkpoints.title: Select the key MAO-B inhibitor motif
checkpoints.hint: MAO-B inhibitors classically contain a propargylamine motif.

checkpoints.title: Rasagiline is primarily a(n):
checkpoints.hint: Rasagiline inhibits MAO-B → decreases dopamine breakdown.

checkpoints.title: Select the key MAO-B inhibitor motif
checkpoints.hint: Selegiline’s signature is the propargylamine warhead (classic MAO inhibitor feature).

checkpoints.title: Key counseling concept (class-level) is:
choices: risk of serotonin toxicity with serotonergic drugs (concept)
correct: risk of serotonin toxicity with serotonergic drugs (concept)
checkpoints.hint: Reinforce serotonergic interaction precautions as a class concept.

checkpoints.title: Select the motif most associated with COMT inhibition (teaching motif)
checkpoints.hint: COMT inhibitor scaffolds are commonly taught with a nitrocatechol-like motif.

checkpoints.title: Entacapone is primarily a(n):
checkpoints.hint: Entacapone inhibits COMT mainly peripherally to prolong levodopa effect.

checkpoints.title: Tolcapone differs from entacapone by:
choices: having central + peripheral COMT inhibition (teaching distinction)
correct: having central + peripheral COMT inhibition (teaching distinction)
checkpoints.hint: Tolcapone is taught as more central-acting than entacapone.

checkpoints.title: Major safety flag to reinforce is:
checkpoints.hint: Tolcapone has a well-known liver safety warning/monitoring requirement.

checkpoints.title: Select the most important binding feature (teaching motif)
checkpoints.hint: Many dopamine agonists have an ionizable basic center important for receptor interaction.

checkpoints.title: Pramipexole is primarily a(n):
checkpoints.hint: Pramipexole is a dopamine agonist (commonly taught D2/D3).

checkpoints.title: Select the most important binding feature (teaching motif)
checkpoints.hint: Dopamine agonists often include an ionizable basic center.

checkpoints.title: Ropinirole is primarily a(n):
checkpoints.hint: Ropinirole is a dopamine agonist used for PD motor symptoms.

checkpoints.title: Rotigotine is best recognized as:
checkpoints.hint: Rotigotine is commonly taught as the transdermal dopamine agonist.

checkpoints.title: Which property supports transdermal delivery (concept)?
checkpoints.hint: Transdermal delivery generally favors lipophilicity (within limits).

checkpoints.title: Select the core scaffold
checkpoints.hint: Amantadine is an adamantane (cage) amine — rigid and lipophilic.

checkpoints.title: Amantadine is best associated with which concept (teaching)?
checkpoints.hint: Amantadine is taught as NMDA-related and used for dyskinesia management.
